com.hcl.domino.keep.cache

Interface NameLookupCache

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    NameLookupCacheHolder

    public interface NameLookupCache

    Cache to lookup NotesNames by email and eMail by NotesName expires after a few hours

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void add(java.lang.String notesName, java.lang.String eMail)
      Manually adds a cache entry into the caches
      void clear()
      Clears out the cache, reset to empty
      void evict(java.lang.String notesName, java.lang.String eMail)
      Removes an cache entry from both Name and eMail lookup

      Retrieve the Internet eMail associated with a NotesName
      java.util.Optional<java.lang.String> getEmailFromNotesName(com.hcl.domino.DominoClient client, java.lang.String notesName, boolean ignoreCache)
      Retrieve the Internet eMail associated with a NotesName
      default java.util.Optional<java.lang.String> getNotesNameFromEmail(com.hcl.domino.DominoClient client, java.lang.String eMailString)
      Retrieve a NotesName from an eMailId

      Retrieve a NotesName from an eMailId
      java.util.Set<java.lang.String> toEMail(com.hcl.domino.DominoClient client, java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> source)
      Translates a set of NotesName / eMail mix to eMails When an eMail is not found, the un-converted Name (which could be a group) gets returned
      default io.vertx.core.json.JsonArray toEMailJson(com.hcl.domino.DominoClient client, io.vertx.core.json.JsonArray source)
      Translates a set of NotesName / eMail mix to eMails When an eMail is not found, the un-converted Name (which could be a group) gets returned

      Translates a set of eMails to NotesNames When an NotesName is not found, the un-converted eMail gets returned

        Retrieve a NotesName from an eMailId

        Parameters:
        client - DominoClient
        eMailString -
        • the eMail too look up
        ignoreCache -
        • true -> cache is ignored, full scan
        Returns:
        a qualified NotesName as Optional, empty if user not found

        Retrieve a NotesName from an eMailId

        • the eMail too look up
        Returns:

      • getEmailFromNotesName

        java.util.Optional<java.lang.String> getEmailFromNotesName(com.hcl.domino.DominoClient client,
                                                           java.lang.String notesName,
                                                           boolean ignoreCache)

        Retrieve the Internet eMail associated with a NotesName

        Parameters:
        client - DominoClient
        notesName - a fully qualified Notes Name (X500) e.g. CN=John Doe/OU=Alpha/O=Acme Corp
        ignoreCache -
        • true -> cache is ignored, full scan
        Returns:
        Optional with eMail, empty if that user doesn’t exist

      • getEmailFromNotesName

        default java.util.Optional<java.lang.String> getEmailFromNotesName(com.hcl.domino.DominoClient client,
                                                                   java.lang.String notesName)

        Retrieve the Internet eMail associated with a NotesName

        Parameters:
        client - DominoClient
        notesName - a fully qualified Notes Name (X500) e.g. CN=John Doe/OU=Alpha/O=Acme Corp
        Returns:
        Optional with eMail, empty if that user doesn’t exist

      • toEMail

                                        java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> source)

        Translates a set of NotesName / eMail mix to eMails When an eMail is not found, the un-converted Name (which could be a group) gets returned

        Parameters:

        source -
        Returns:
        mostly eMails
